intro: Eschscholzia alcicornis, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes罂粟 (poppies) and other related species. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and has delicate, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and branching. The Sierra primrose is valued for its ornamental beauty and its role in supporting local pollinators.
